intro: Neuropeltis malabarica, commonly known as the Malabar orchid, is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is native to the Western Ghats of India. It is a terrestrial orchid with a slender, erect stem and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in dense forests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
